original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down; Rupee closes 332/335
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed down on Monday, as investors are waiting for the final decision of the International Monetary Fund’s executive board decision, dealers said.
According to the State Minister of Finance, Shehan Semasinghe, executive board decision is expected later in the day.
A 01.07.2025 bond closed at 30.75/31.25 percent on Monday, down from 31.00/30 percent on Friday.
A 15.09.2027 bond closed at 28.00/20 percent, down from 28.15/40 percent from Friday.
Rupee closed at stronger at 332/335 against the US dollar on Monday up from 337/345 on Friday. (Colombo/ March20/2023)
